FuncDef: This command configures the rate that Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Time To Live (TTL) expired messages are issued by the IP interface.

ParaDef.Info: The maximum number of ICMP TTL expired messages to send, expressed as a decimal integer. The seconds parameter must also be specified. Values-10 to 2000.
The time frame, in seconds, used to limit the number of ICMP TTL expired messages that can be issued, expressed as a decimal integer. Values-1 to 60.

ExtraInfo: Default: ttl-expired 100 10 - Maximum of 100 TTL expired message in 10 seconds.
